newsitem.title: ITALY: ITALY TO PRESS FOR ROMANIA, SLOVENIA IN NATO.
newsitem.headline: ITALY TO PRESS FOR ROMANIA, SLOVENIA IN NATO.

text.p: Italy will urge the United States at a NATO summit this week to trust Europe's judgement and invite Romania and Slovenia into NATO, Prime Minister Romano Prodi said in an interview on Monday with the International Herald Tribune.

"We will repeat our view. We go to Madrid for discussions and not for a quarrel, but since we have meditated briefly on our proposal, we will stick to it", Prodi said in the interview on the eve of the 16-nation summit in Madrid.
NATO countries are due to agree at the summit to the extension of the Western alliance into former communist central and eastern Europe.
The United States has said it only wants to see the entry of three former Warsaw Pact states -- Poland, the Czech Republic and Hungary -- in the first wave of new entrants.

Italy, France and seven other European allies want Romania and Slovenia to be added to that list, arguing that they qualify both as democratic market economies and as states in need of security on the edge of Black Sea and Balkan danger zones.
"We should not forget that ethnic rivalry inside Romania was one of our nightmares regarding the future of Eastern Europe, and they have resolved the issue," Prodi said in the interview.
Prodi urged President Bill Clinton to trust European judgement on the matter.

"I think he can trust Europe. The enlargement of NATO regards Europe essentially. For this reason we favor a balanced enlargement of NATO in both the north and the south of Europe", he said. "Europe cannot be denied its views on problems in its own region", he added. REUTER
